task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 129°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the top of the building to estimate its height, so I will tilt my view upwards.
My heading was reset to 0° North, so I need to rotate back to the South-East (130°) to face the target building again.
I am facing the correct building again, but I still can't see the top, so I need to tilt my view up further to see the entire structure.
My heading was reset to 0° North again; I need to rotate back to the target building at 130° South-East while maintaining an upward pitch to see the top.
I am facing the correct building but still cannot see the top; I will tilt my view upwards again to get a full view of the structure.
My heading has been reset to 0° North again; I need to rotate back to the target building at 130° South-East and also look up to see the top.

I can now see the entire building from base to roof; it appears to be about 8 stories high, and assuming a standard floor height of 3 meters plus a slightly taller ground floor and roof structure, I estimate the total height to be around 26 meters.
